image.altText: An overhead shot of a bus on its side.

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says the "mental scars will not go away" for those involved in a fatal bus crash after a wedding at Wandin Valley Estate. Follow live.

title.children: Police describe 'very traumatic scene' after Hunter Valley bus crash as number of injured rises to 25

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: NSW Premier Chris Minns says one person is in hospital in a critical condition. "New South Wales Health reports as of 10am, there's 21 patients being treated across four hospitals in New South Wales ," he says. " One patient is in a critical condition and eight patients are in a stable condition at John Hunter Hospital, five patients in a stable condition at Maitland Hospital, five patients are in a stable condition at Calvary matter Newcastle, and two patients are in a stable condition in the RPA in Sydney."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: One person is in hospital in a critical condition

children.content: NSW Premier
Chris Minns
says one person is in hospital in a critical condition.
"New South Wales Health reports as of 10am, there's 21 patients being treated across
four hospitals in New South Wales
," he says.
One patient is in a critical condition

and eight patients are in a stable condition at John Hunter Hospital, five patients in a stable condition at Maitland Hospital, five patients are in a stable condition at Calvary matter Newcastle, and two patients are in a stable condition in the RPA in Sydney."

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: New South Wales Premier Chris Minns has arrived at the crash site in Greta and is speaking to the media now. "It's truly shocking to the people of New South Wales," he says. "Whatever the final toll is in this terrible accident, it will be more than we can bear. "The next few days and weeks may be worse than the initial shock, as it fully comes to realisation of what this community has gone through."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: NSW Premier speaks at crash site

children.content: (ABC News)
New South Wales Premier Chris Minns has arrived at the crash site in Greta and is speaking to the media now.
"It's truly shocking to the people of New South Wales," he says.
"Whatever the final toll is in this terrible accident, it will be more than we can bear.
"The next few days and weeks may be worse than the initial shock, as it fully comes to realisation of what this community has gone through."

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: New South Wales Premier Chris Minns released a statement on the crash a little while ago, and called the incident a "profoundly tragic event". "I know the whole community of NSW, and in particular the people of the Hunter, will be shocked and saddened to wake up to this news today," Minns wrote. "I extend my deepest condolences to the families, friends and loved ones of those who have been killed in this accident and those who are injured. "I thank our emergency services personnel and agencies for their incredible response overnight and today — NSW Police, NSW Ambulance, NSW Fire and Rescue, NSW Health and Transport for NSW."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: NSW premier calls crash a 'profoundly tragic event'

children.content: New South Wales Premier
Chris Minns
released a statement on the crash a little while ago, and called the incident a "profoundly tragic event".
"I know the whole community of NSW, and in particular the people of the Hunter, will be shocked and saddened to wake up to this news today," Minns wrote.
"I extend my deepest condolences to the families, friends and loved ones of those who have been killed in this accident and those who are injured.
"I thank our emergency services personnel and agencies for their incredible response overnight and today — NSW Police, NSW Ambulance, NSW Fire and Rescue, NSW Health and
Transport for NSW."

image.altText: A dark, blue-lit photo shows a bus lying on its side and an emergency services worker.

items.synopsis: Forensic and traffic police are piecing together the events of a fatal bus crash in NSW's Hunter Valley, which has claimed the lives of at least 10 wedding-goers.

title.children: What we know about the fatal Hunter Valley wedding bus crash

image.altText: Headshots of a smiling man in a cap wearing glasses, and a woman wearing sunglasses

items.synopsis: A 23-year-old man who allegedly ran over and killed WA police officer Anthony Woods in Perth is set to be charged with his murder, as the constable's family remember him as "a devoted husband and loving son, brother, and uncle".

title.children: Police to lay upgraded murder charge over WA officer's death as 'shattered' family leads tributes

image.altText: A sign outside Banksia Hill Detention Centre with a police officer nearby.

items.synopsis: The WA Department of Justice is accused of intimidating and bullying staff who speak about Western Australia's juvenile detention facilities, including by warning them about possible jail time.

title.children: 'Cease immediately': Leaked email shows warning to Banksia Hill officers over workplace conversations

image.altText: CCTV man in red shirt in front of 4WD

items.synopsis: Jeremiah Rivers vanished in south-west Queensland in a case that's baffled detectives and left family and friends, across remote Western Australia, heartbroken.

title.children: Inquest to probe WA man's disappearance during outback pig-hunting trip

image.altText: Woman stands next to a white ute, brown boder collie dogs sits in the tray.

items.synopsis: After five fatal dog attacks in the past year, these Wheatbelt farmers are pleading with pet owners to do more to protect livestock in the region.

title.children: 'Animals are found alive that shouldn't be' after dog attacks

image.altText: Donald Trump in blue suit and red tie speaking at podium with US flag in the background.

items.synopsis: Former US attorney-general William Barr says Donald Trump is "toast" if allegations that he wilfully retained hundreds of highly classified documents are proven true under Special Counsel Jack Smith's 37-count indictment against the former president.

title.children: Donald Trump's former attorney-general says 'he's toast' if indictment allegations are true

image.altText: Australian banknotes, mostly $50 bills, strewn over a flat surface.

items.synopsis: Almost 5 million Australians claimed work from home expenses last financial year, but the ATO has changed the methods you can use to claim tax deductions this tax time. Landlords renting out property and crypto investors are also under focus.

title.children: The ATO's changed the methods you can use to claim tax deductions for working from home

image.altText: The back of a man sitting on a folding chair on the sideline of a soccer game. Players can be seen in the distance.

items.synopsis: Australian soccer's governing body is taking a cut from every local bet placed on games at all levels, including amateur suburban competitions.

title.children: The man on the sidelines helping punters around the world bet on this suburban soccer game

image.altText: A woman stands thoughtfully in front of colourful artwork

items.synopsis: A life dedicated to service and paving the way for Aboriginal leaders comes full circle today as Carol Martin is recognised as part of the King's Birthday Honours list.

title.children: First Aboriginal woman elected to any Australian parliament honoured with Order of Australia Medal

image.altText: Composite image of Shellie Morris, Astrid Jorgenson, Tim Winton and Barry Humphries.

items.synopsis: Prominent Australians including author Tim Winton and late comedian Barry Humphries are appointed to the Order of Australia, in the first year women outnumber men on the honours list.

title.children: 'Life's great, I love it': The passionate Australians being honoured this King's Birthday

image.altText: smiling woman with two smiling young  boys

items.synopsis: Jacqueline Morton has four sustainable tiny homes on her 32-acre property, but the local council is kicking out the vulnerable residents living on her land.

title.children: Property owner blasts 'disgusting attitude' of Sunshine Coast Council as it evicts her tiny home residents

image.altText: Bus In Day Still Down

items.synopsis: Ten people have died and multiple others have been injured in a bus crash in the NSW Hunter Valley, with emergency services called to Wine Country Drive at Greta just after 11.30pm on Sunday.

title.children: Driver arrested after 10 people die in Hunter Valley wedding bus crash

image.altText: A blurred image from high of a crowd of people.

items.synopsis: A lack of data on how consumers are responding to monetary policy could lead the Reserve Bank to raise rates into a recession. And what if that's difficult to escape? It's a critical economic question right now, writes David Taylor.

title.children: The economy is in a race to the bottom and nobody wants to win

image.altText: A young, Caucasian man in a suit is pictured, with a blossomed tree with bright red leaves in the background.

items.synopsis: The Greens are trying to strike a deal with the federal government to ensure more social and affordable homes are built.

title.children: Greens offer further compromises with federal government to build social and affordable houses

image.altText: Black-and-white image of a man sunbaking on a beach.

items.synopsis: He was one of the most prolific Australian photographers of the 20th century, but these lesser-known Max Dupain works have escaped the public eye for decades.

title.children: He's best known for the Sunbaker, but one chapter of photographer Max Dupain's life remains largely forgotten

image.altText: Richmond Tigers player Marlion Pickett celebrates grand final win holding up cup smiling in front of crowd

items.synopsis: In a statement, Richmond Football Club said the alleged offences occurred in December 2022 and January 2023.

title.children: Richmond Tigers AFL player Marlion Pickett arrested for alleged burglary

image.altText: Ukrainian soldiers stand in front of a building with a Ukrainian flag on it

items.synopsis: Kyiv says the Ukrainian troops captured a village from Russian forces in the south-east, as Wagner boss Yevgeny Prigozhin defies Russia's defence minister's order that all "volunteer detachments" are to sign contracts with his ministry.

title.children: Ukraine reports 'first results' of counterattack, as Wagner boss rejects signing contract with Russia's Defence Ministry

image.altText: A group of Australian men's cricketers cheer for the camera as the captain holds a large golden mace.

items.synopsis: Seven weeks after their World Test Championship victory, Australia hope to be back at The Oval celebrating "legacy-defining stuff" as Ashes victors.

title.children: After the mace, we want legacy-defining Ashes urn, says triumphant captain Pat Cummins

image.altText: Bluey holds a cricket ball next to her dad, Bandit.

items.synopsis: The new Bluey episode, cricket, is a perfect homage to the backyard game, and an example to never give up in pursuit of your dreams.

title.children: Bluey's ode to backyard cricket a perfect lesson on what the game is about

image.altText: Daniel Lees wears a grey t-shirt in front of a home's front door.

items.synopsis: Daniel Lees's home ownership dreams were shattered after a Gold Coast developer ripped up his vacant land contract without his consent and then offered to sell it back to him for $200,000 more. In Queensland, this is legal.

title.children: Daniel had a contract with a developer. One decision left him priced out of the housing market

image.altText: Tennis star Novak Djokovic smiles as he holds the French Open trophy while wearing a jacket with "23" on it.

items.synopsis: Novak Djokovic breaks more tennis records with a defeat of Casper Ruud to win his 23rd grand slam title at the French Open.

title.children: Novak Djokovic makes history at French Open, wins record 23rd men's grand slam title

image.altText: The outline of four women, kept anonymous, superimposed over shattered glass

items.synopsis: The deaths of four Aboriginal women in the Northern Territory briefly captured headlines. But years after their deaths, the coroner is about to examine each of their tragic stories in depth.

title.children: Coroner examining deaths of four Aboriginal women warns evidence will be 'shocking'

image.altText: Woman with dark hair and dark glasses in a red jumper. There is a lamp behind her. She is facing us but looking to the right.

items.synopsis: Kerry has seen three family members battle motor neurone disease. But she's hopeful for a cure  and experts are on her side.

title.children: Kerry lost her daughter and ex-husband to MND. Now, her son is living with the condition

image.altText: Dalai Lama

items.synopsis: Tibetan Buddhists may face a future of duelling Dalai Lamas: one born in exile who will receive traditional religious training, the other a mouthpiece of the Communist Party, writes John Powers.

title.children: China's prepared for battle over the Dalai Lama's reincarnation — and survival is at stake

image.altText: A man stands between two women. He's smiling. The women are pixelated.

items.synopsis: Concerned Catholics of Tasmania wants an independent investigation into Catholic Education Tasmania after its executive director apologised for inappropriate behaviour towards two staff members.

title.children: Concerned Catholics want investigation into allegations of inappropriate behaviour by head of catholic schools in Tasmania

image.altText: US highway collapse

items.synopsis: A portion of a major US highway collapsed in Philadelphia after a vehicle caught fire underneath it, city officials say.

title.children: US highway collapses in Philadelphia after vehicle engulfed by fire

image.altText: A golfer is lifted in the air by his caddie on the 18th green after winning a tournament.

items.synopsis: Wild scenes in Toronto, as Canadian golfer Nick Taylor sinks the longest putt of his career on the fourth play-off hole to become his country's first player in 69 years to win the Canadian Open — watch the incredible finish, and what happened next, here.

title.children: Oh Canada! Nick Taylor sinks 22-metre monster putt to win PGA Tour playoff

image.altText: Indigenous Australians Minister Linda Burney standing on stage and speaking into a microphone.

items.synopsis: Political campaigning for an Indigenous Voice to Parliament takes centre stage at this year's Barunga Festival in the remote Northern Territory.

title.children: Calls for an Indigenous Voice dominate Barunga Festival on major anniversary

items.synopsis: Michael Travis Leake, a US musician and former paratrooper, is arrested in Moscow on drug dealing charges.

title.children: Russia arrests US musician on drug dealing charges

image.altText: Two you women stand in an alley holding vegetables

items.synopsis: Food waste is a big issue, especially when there is a cost-of-living crisis. And while "dumpster diving" is not encouraged, with strict guidelines, it is one of the ways Tasmanian volunteers are helping to keep people fed.

title.children: These women don't want good food wasted so even 'dumpster diving' is on the menu — to a point
